About Our CubeSat Project

Pioneering space research and education at the University of Málaga through innovative satellite technology.

Project Background

The University of Málaga CubeSat Project was initiated in 2023 as an interdisciplinary initiative to design, build, and launch a 3U CubeSat satellite. This project brings together students and faculty from various departments including Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Telecommunications, and Computer Science.

Our CubeSat aims to conduct scientific experiments in the space environment while providing hands-on educational opportunities for university students. The project follows the CubeSat standard developed by California Polytechnic State University, which defines specifications for small satellites that can be launched as secondary payloads.

With support from the European Space Agency and various industry partners, we're working toward a planned launch in 2025.

Project Objectives

Educational

  • • Provide hands-on experience in satellite development
  • • Train students in space systems engineering
  • • Bridge theoretical knowledge with practical applications
  • • Develop multidisciplinary collaboration skills

Scientific

  • • Collect atmospheric data from low Earth orbit
  • • Test novel radiation-resistant electronics
  • • Experiment with miniaturized scientific instruments
  • • Validate theoretical models in space conditions

Technological

  • • Develop innovative attitude control systems
  • • Create efficient power management solutions
  • • Design reliable satellite communication protocols
  • • Advance miniaturization techniques for space hardware

Project Timeline

Current Project Status

Track the progress of our CubeSat project from conception to launch with our detailed timeline.

Project Initiation

Completed

March 2023

Project approved by the University Board and initial funding secured.

Design Phase

Completed

September 2023

CubeSat design finalized and reviewed by aerospace engineering partners.

Component Acquisition

In Progress

January 2024

Procurement of hardware components and testing equipment.

Assembly & Integration

Upcoming

June 2024

Integration of all subsystems and initial testing procedures.

Testing & Verification

Upcoming

October 2024

Environmental testing and verification of all systems.

Launch Preparation

Upcoming

March 2025

Final checks and preparations for launch.
